titleStmt.title: Englands great deliverance, or Great Britains fears and tears in joy compleated, the Popes great hopes, priests, monks, and all defeated. Our noble King and Queen God's agents were, then God preserve them, as he sent them here.
titleStmt.author: T. S.

titleStmt.title: Englands great deliverance, or Great Britains fears and tears in joy compleated, the Popes great hopes, priests, monks, and all defeated. Our noble King and Queen God's agents were, then God preserve them, as he sent them here.
titleStmt.author: T. S.

publicationStmt.publisher: Printed for John Newton, near the Sugar Loaf in Bell-Alley, Coleman-street,

notesStmt.note: Verse: "When this most noble kingdom, Britain great".
"April the 6th. 1689. This may be printed R. Midgley."
Reproduction of original in the British Library.
